result.trip_overview_narrative: North Yarmouth Academy offers annual class trips for Middle and Upper School students, typically overnight, focusing on team building, community, and service. Lower School students participate in local field trips emphasizing nature and experiential learning. The Kauffmann Program provides wilderness travel opportunities centered on environmental conservation and education.

programs.frequency: at least once each year, sometimes twice

evidence.quote: At least once each year (sometimes twice!), Upper and Middle School students take a class trip, usually an overnight. These trips promote team building and community and often have a service component. Recent trips include a visit to New York City to spend timeâ€¦

Lower School students learn to skate in our ice arena, play instruments like the violin and ukulele, grow vegetables in our campus greenhouse, perform in plays, and outside of the classroom, learn in nature.

With a focus on environmental thinking, writing, conservation, and wilderness travel, The Kauffmann Program creates opportunities for NYA students, high school students across Maine, and the larger community to acknowledge the importance of wilderness conservation and environmental issues.

unknowns: Exact duration of Kauffmann Program trips
Frequency of Lower School field trips
